title: Ultra-low rates make the world economy more risky and less resilient, warns Bank of England Deputy Governor Sir Jon Cunliffe
text:
The world economy is increasingly risky as ultra-low interest rates drive banks, pension funds and insurers to make dangerous financial decisions, the Bank of England’s deputy governor for financial stability has warned.

Banks and money managers struggle to make decent returns on safe loans and investments, so more cash is going towards heavily indebted businesses and ever-larger mortgages, Sir Jon Cunliffe said.

He said that on the other side of the coin, businesses and households are building up bigger debts, which are affordable for now but could cause trouble if a recession strikes, unemployment spikes and the loans become unsustainable.
